docs.snippet: About 90 women have reported being robbed, threatened or sexually molested at New Year celebrations outside Cologne's cathedral by young, mostly drunk, men, police said on Tuesday, in events they have described as 'a new dimension in crime'....
docs.lead_paragraph: About 90 women have reported being robbed, threatened or sexually molested at New Year celebrations outside Cologne's cathedral by young, mostly drunk, men, police said on Tuesday, in events they have described as 'a new dimension in crime'.

headline.main: Germans Shaken by New Year Attacks on Women in Cologne
headline.print_headline: Germans Shaken by New Year Attacks on Women in Cologne

docs.snippet: David Bowie, whose music has been as changeable as his image, enlisted the Donny McCaslin Quartet, a rugged jazz-rock combo, for his new album....
docs.lead_paragraph: David Bowie, whose music has been as changeable as his image, enlisted the Donny McCaslin Quartet, a rugged jazz-rock combo, for his new album.
docs.abstract: David Bowie will release album Blackstar, collaboration with jazz-rock ensemble Donny McCaslin Quartet, this January; producer Tony Visconti explains latest collection is another example of Bowie’s metamorphic music style, this time inspired by improvisational nature of jazz.

headline.main: On David Bowie’s ‘Blackstar,’ Turning to Jazz for Inspiration
headline.print_headline: New CD by Bowie Is Rooted in Jazz

docs.snippet: Congressional Republicans won’t pass even basic, sensible gun-safety measures, so Mr. Obama is doing what he can through executive actions....
docs.lead_paragraph: Congressional Republicans won’t pass even basic, sensible gun-safety measures, so Mr. Obama is doing what he can through executive actions.
docs.abstract: Editorial lauds Pres Obama for executive actions aimed at limiting criminals' access to guns; notes expansion of dealer licensing and streamlining of background checks, despite condemnation from Republican presidential candidates, merely enforces existing laws and echoes demands of gun-rights activists; calls on Congress to pass further protections, which overwhelming majority of Americans endorse.

headline.main: The President Acts on Gun Violence
headline.print_headline: The President Acts on Gun Violence

docs.snippet: The moves by the two Scandinavian countries represented another step in the erosion of the ideal of borderless travel across most of the European Union....
docs.lead_paragraph: The moves by the two Scandinavian countries represented another step in the erosion of the ideal of borderless travel across most of the European Union.
docs.abstract: Ongoing flow of migrants into northern Europe prompts Sweden and Denmark, once among region's more welcoming countries, to tighten borders; measures responding to economic concerns, practical difficulties of processing refugees and populist anti-immigrant political pressure, further imperil goal of frictionless intercontinental travel.

headline.main: Sweden and Denmark Add Border Checks to Stem Flow of Migrants
headline.print_headline: Sweden and Denmark Tighten Border Controls to Stem Flow of Migrants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin.

docs.snippet: Tuesday: A look at city politics in 2016, freezing weather, and mulching your Christmas tree....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tuesday: A look at city politics in 2016, freezing weather, and mulching your Christmas tree.

headline.main: New York Today: Empire State of Conflict

docs.snippet: So far, local, state and federal law enforcement agencies have taken a low-key approach, wary of past confrontations that turned into violent sieges....
docs.lead_paragraph: So far, local, state and federal law enforcement agencies have taken a low-key approach, wary of past confrontations that turned into violent sieges.
docs.abstract: Group of armed protesters calling itself Citizens for Constitutional Freedom takes over Malheur National Wildlife Refuge in Oregon as part of national movement to force Washington to release its hold on vast tracts of Western land; occupation, which is so far tolerated by federal government, is latest battle in long-running fight between Westerners who make living off the land and federal government that controls much of it.

headline.main: Cautious Response to Armed Oregon Protest
headline.print_headline: Occupying Federal Land, to Little Response

byline.contributor: Kirk Johnson reported from Burns, and Richard Pérez-Peña and Erik Eckholm from New York. Jack Healy contributed reporting from Denver, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington.
byline.original: By KIRK JOHNSON, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and ERIK ECKHOLM

docs.snippet: President Obama’s executive actions on guns will stop short of the kind of large-scale changes that he unsuccessfully sought from Congress three years ago....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s executive actions on guns will stop short of the kind of large-scale changes that he unsuccessfully sought from Congress three years ago.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama will announce executive actions designed to widen background checks for some gun sales and increase federal enforcement of nation's firearms laws; modest steps represent another attempt to bypass gridlocked Congress on divisive issue.

headline.main: Obama to Expand Gun Background Checks and Tighten Enforcement
headline.print_headline: Obama to Expand Gun Sale Checks

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ERIC LICHTBLAU

docs.snippet: Federal prosecutors stopped short of criminal charges and did not single out individuals in the scandal, but the Clean Air Act penalties could top $19 billion....
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors stopped short of criminal charges and did not single out individuals in the scandal, but the Clean Air Act penalties could top $19 billion.
docs.abstract: Justice Dept sues Volkswagen in federal court, charging company put illegal devices in almost 600,000 diesel engine systems to impair emissions controls, exacerbating air pollution; stops short of criminal charges and does not name individuals.

headline.main: U.S. Sues Volkswagen in Diesel Emissions Scandal
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sues Volkswagen for Cheating on Emissions Tests

byline.contributor: Coral Davenport reported from Washington and Danny Hakim from London. Matt Apuzzo contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By CORAL DAVENPORT and DANNY HAKIM
